Subject: questions about mdot, mfluxie, anchoring of the flame
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=223649316; y=xCQ4MAvkhUUtcFd70rRk0AloXdgFhh3_da1OrdND3ZdSJw

Dear Dave,

The example file flame1.m requires a value for
mdot.

(1) Is this value a boundary
condition to a differential equation
dmdot/dx, added to the system of conservation
equations (species, energy)? The reason for
asking this question is that imposing mdot
makes the system overdetermined if it is not
a boundary condition of an additional differential
equation.


(2) The value of mdot is imposed at both the inflow
and outflow domain. Although the flames we calculated
up to now achor themseves at the inlet boundary,
I wondered whether the location of acnchoring depends
on the value of mdot. Or is there some kind of
"translational invariance" due to imposing mdot?

With best regards,

Arief
